8/ TL;DR:

GHOST isn't haunting blockchains, it‚Äôs helping them scale.

By using all valid blocks, not just the main chain, it improves throughput and fairness.

Even if Ethereum moved on, GHOST‚Äôs spirit lives on in newer protocols. üëª‚öôÔ∏è

#CoinDCX #CryptoEducation #Consensus

5/ Why Ethereum Dropped GHOST?

GHOST was clever but added implementation complexity.
Ethereum opted for a "total difficulty" chain rule instead simpler to maintain and scale.

Uncle rewards stayed, but subtree logic was dropped.

3/ Ethereum's Early Adoption

Ethereum once used a simplified GHOST.

Uncle blocks (valid but stale) were included up to 7 levels back.

Miners still got paid 87.5% reward for uncles, 12.5% for the including miner.
‚úÖ Efficient
üö´ But complex
üí° Ethereum later abandoned full
